name: donbass.vim
summary: Finely tuned, 256 color, light-grey background colorscheme
description:
This is a light-background colorscheme for 256-color terminals and GUI. It was inspired by xoria256.vim colorscheme (vimscript #2140) by Dmitriy Y. Zotikov (xio) <xio@ungrund.org>, though you probably won't find anything in common. I wanted such beautiful colors as xoria but with light background.

Screenshots:
http://i.piccy.info/i4/d6/69/98d9f22ba6312262af3d909805ec.png
http://i.piccy.info/i4/d3/8d/5e1f639a96a7345b7e0d21851823.png

Color numbers (0-255) taken from Calmar's site:
http://www.calmar.ws/vim/256-xterm-24bit-rgb-color-chart.html

Suggestions and patches are welcome.
install_details:
1. Put donbass.vim in your ~/.vim/colors/  or so.
2. In vim itself or your vimrc file:

" possibly needed if you use terminal
set t_Co=256

colorscheme donbass

versions.release_notes:
Spellcheking highlighting.
Non-bold wildmenu.
Underlined text normal-colored.
